thread.title: Business event: redefining yourself for success
thread.title_full: Business event: redefining yourself for success - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Business event: redefining yourself for success
text: The Telegraph knows that in business , success is about taking your chances. But do your customers really understand what you’re offering? Do you understand your proposition yourself? Does your strategy match your ambition? If you’re a leader in a small business, this event provides an unmissable opportunity to discover how to channel your expertise and intelligence into a robust plan for future success. The event will cover the following topics: • Understanding your ambitions • Turning experience into insight • Networking and brand building • Engagement and inspiration Date: 5 November Time: 12-3pm Venue: The Deck, National Theatre Guest speaker – Will Greenwood Rugby World Cup champion Will Greenwood reached the pinnacle of the game in England’s 2003 triumph. Now, he works as a pundit and commentator, calling on his professional experience and the understanding that comes with a lifetime lived in the sport. But in developing his business, SuperSkills Experiences, he has had to start from scratch. He will speak about making that transition – achieving the ultimate in one game and beginning afresh in another, the ambition that drove him to do so, and how his strategy was informed by his prior experiences. Together with a panel, he’ll be encouraging the audience to consider where their businesses came from, where they are going, and what will be required of everyone to get there. This event is limited to 100 people and places will be allocated on a first-come, first-served basis. If you would like to attend, request your tickets in the below form.
